snippet.title: "Black Mass Red Carpet" with Johnny Depp, Amber Heard and Dakota Johnson
snippet.description:
Things got a little crazy at the world premiere of Johnny Depp's new gangster film, Black Mass, as he hit the red carpet with wife Amber Heard and Dakota Johnson.

Johnny Depp-starrer “Black Mass” world-premiered to positive response Friday at the Venice Film Festival where a relaxed Depp held court, musing on the challenges of playing Boston gangster James “Whitey” Bulger naturalistically, including a dramatically receding hairline, and how he feels risky physical transformations are part of his duty to give audiences “something new each time.” Director Scott Cooper’s biopic of Bulger, who became an FBI informant and used this status to eliminate criminal competition during the 1970s, ’80s and early ’90s, was greeted with applause at the Venice press screening and the press conference was packed to the rafters.

Depp downplayed the purely criminal component of Bulger, whom he described as an man of “very proud Irish immigrant stock, who was loyal to his neighborhood.”
